intro: Grevea, commonly known as the Mexican fire tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers that range from red to orange, often resembling flames. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, native to Central America and parts of South America. They have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Grevea species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral display.
